items.sentence: I know you probably want to be alone, so I\'ll leave.
I thought Tom and Mary were supposed to be in Boston.
I thought Tom would go with you on your camping trip.
I used to be able to see the garden from this window.
I used to live in the same apartment building as Tom.
I used to work in a restaurant when I was in college.
I wish I had the will power to stop eating junk food.
Tom opened the door to see what the weather was like.
Tom opened the medicine cabinet, looking for aspirin.
Tom patiently tried to explain the situation to Mary.
Tom plans on staying with us when he comes to Boston.
Tom planted a small peach tree in front of his house.
Nobody could\'ve known that this was going to happen.
Please don\'t allow the children to play with knives.
You forgot to thank Tom for the present, didn\'t you?
I just want to make sure we\'re all on the same page.
Tom doesn\'t have to pay attention to what Mary says.
Tom doesn\'t know if Mary wants to go with us or not.
Tom doesn\'t know who wrote the graffiti on the wall.
I just think you should be more careful, that\'s all.
I shouldn\'t have said the things that I said to you.
We got to Washington in time for the cherry blossoms.
We kept on working for hours without eating anything.
Whales are very large mammals that live in the ocean.
I used to think it was my responsibility to help Tom.
It makes no difference to me whether he comes or not.
It smells as though someone has been smoking in here.
The owners want you out of this house by next Monday.
The people that died were all volunteer firefighters.
The police arrested the person they think killed Tom.
The police detained several suspects for questioning.
The policeman gave Tom a ticket for reckless driving.
I don\'t think Tom knows when Mary will leave Boston.
I don\'t think Tom knows when Mary will visit Boston.
I don\'t think Tom will be going to Boston with Mary.
I don\'t think that Tom can do that without our help.
He knows everything that there is to know about jazz.
He saw at a glance that his daughter had been crying.
His name is Tom and he lives next to the post office.
Everybody does stupid stuff like that in high school.
Everybody falls in love at least once in their lives.
Everybody knew there was something terrible going on.
Everyone is drinking, and nearly everyone is smoking.
French is the only foreign language that I can speak.
Tom came down with a cold and couldn\'t go to school.
Tom can\'t do his job without an internet connection.
Tom dove into the water and swam as fast as he could.
What\'s the nationality of that cameraman over there?
I don\'t want to eat Chinese food for dinner tonight.
It\'s no use pretending that you can\'t speak French.
